global_prevalence(pango_lin, mutations, cumulative)¶

outbreak_data.global_prevalence(pango_lin, mutations=None, cumulative=None, server='api.outbreak.info')¶

Retrieves data from all mutations in a specified lineage above a frequency threshold. Mutiple queries for lineages and mutations can be separated by “,”

Parameters:

  • pango_lin (str) – (Required). A string; loads data for all mutations in a specified PANGO lineage

  • mutations (str or list[str]) – (Optional). A string or list; loads mutation data for sequences classified under a specified PANGO lineage

  • cumulative (bool) – (Optional). If true, returns values for global prevalence, lineage count, and number of cases for specified lineage.

  • freq (float) – (Optional). A number between 0 and 1 specifying the frequency threshold above which to return mutations (default = 0.8)

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame

prevalence_by_location(location, startswith)

sequence_counts(location, cumulative, sub_admin)
